results.name: Square table read by antidiagonals which forms a permutation of the natural numbers: T(n,0) = floor(n*x/(x-1))+1, T(n,k+1) = ceiling(x*T(n,k)), for n>=0, k>=0, where x = 1 + sqrt(2).
comment: The array in A083087 is the dispersion of the sequence given floor(n+1+n*sqrt(2)). The Mathematica program at A191438 generates A083087 using f[n_]:=Floor[n*x+n+1] instead of f[n_]:=Floor[n*x+n]. - _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 04 2011
program: (MAGMA) z:=10; x:=1+Sqrt(2); S:=[]; for n in [0..z] do for k in [0..n] do if n-k eq 0 then Append(~S, Floor(n*x/(x-1))+1); else Append(~S, Ceiling(x*S[k+1+(n*(n-1) div 2)])); end if; end for; end for; S; // _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jan 04 2011
xref: Cf. A083088 (first column), A048739 (first row), A083090 (diagonal), A083091 (antidiagonal sums), A083044, A083047, A083050.
